Some good, non-trivial examples of test-code are out there.. In 
particular, dig into tests for some large open-source project like 
eclipse.

Of course, code in hand will only get you part of the picture. The more 
challenging part of the puzzle is developing a sense of what tests are 
worth the effort. For a lucky few projects, the answer is obvious. For 
everyone else, success relies on cultivating expertise through 
experience (or hiring it).

-- Levi

On Tuesday, April 1, 2003, at 02:07  PM, swpalmer2001 wrote:

> Or is this unit testing just a passing fad that is
> really nothing more than a bunch of hype?

PS> Despite your opening disclaimer this sounds a little like trolling
